problem_text:
Let G be a finite group, and χ an irreducible complex character of G. We call
χ a P-character if χ is a constituent of (1H)G for some maximal subgroup H of G;
and χ is said to be monomial if χ is induced by a linear character of a subgroup of G.
Conjecture: G is solvable if and only if all its P-characters are monomial.
The necessity part of the conjecture is true (G. Qian, Y. Yang, Commun. Algebra,
46, no. 1 (2018), 167–175).
G. Qian
